39407079.review: 非常好玩的一个回合解密游戏，不同于此系列以往的作品，虽然作为手游移植，但是在PC端的表现非常出色。故事完整紧凑，关卡分布合理，整个通关流程流畅。感觉基础关卡就是教学关卡0.0而且让我耿耿于怀的就是最后一个成就，把苹果放在你头上，即在6个格子远投出长矛，实在找不到，有没有好心人能告诉我：）

39379748.review:
虽然是从手机移植过来的，但是用手柄操作体验依然很好。
这个游戏对关卡设计有很多值得借鉴的地方，很多关卡设计的玩过后心中会忍不住大喊：我艹，这也可以！
游戏的死亡设计很合理，倒退的检查点不会有太大挫败感，可以尽情地鼓励玩家去尝试。
刚开始玩的时候会发现有隐藏的物品收集，就会想这我怎么知道一个关有多少没收集到！然后发现再次挑战关卡的时候，游戏简明地标出了该关卡的道具数量（区别开已找到和未找到的），心里佩服的五体投地！这看似简单的设计却有着大智慧，首先没有第一次进某个关卡的时候就告诉你有几个隐藏物品，就是希望你第一次全身心地投入到解谜和冒险里面，否则总是会想着有哪个没拿破坏了游戏体验，当完成一整个关卡再给你看某小关的漏掉物品，你又可以进去专心找找找，非常赞的设计！
游戏没有非常刻意的教傻瓜的新手教程，但是整体设计的都非常简明，让人很容易理解各种怪物和陷阱的原理，真的是厉害。
当卡关了的引导也非常的有新意，而且随时可以停止辅助，非常出众的设计。
游戏里还有一些故意误导你的小场景设计，可以看得出设计者的小心思，都是教科书一样的范例。
我心目中满分的作品，大爱。

A great puzzle game. Each set of levels adds in new elements and mixes them together well, offering new challenges as you go along. If you get stuck there is a handy built-in hint/walkthrough system that will show you the intended solution move by move but allows you to cancel out at any point so you can proceed without further hints. It uses the Tomb Raider/Lara Croft theme well as the game feels like a turn-based Tomb Raider game (with less combat of course).

My only issue is with the controls. You need to 'swipe' to move rather than clicking on the place you want to go to like in Hitman GO. But it is a minor problem that was easy to ignore. Occasionally I would also get a bit of lag when loading new areas but again it was infrequent and not that big of a deal. Certainly not bad enough to avoid the game.

 I got about 6-7 hours of play time out of it and I feel it was money well spent. I'm recommending it especially if you enjoyed Hitman GO.

39150805.review:
Lara Craft GO is a puzzler where every move with Lara on a "grid" is also a move for other actors, like a large boulder or a spider. It's short, to the piont, fun,  engaging. Absolutely recommended.

The game reaches out to classic Lara (yes I played Tomb Raider 1 and 2 in the 90s), which is kind of nice. In combination with the great aesthetics, animations (including Lara's classic hand stand), music, ambiants and sound fx, this works very well. 

The puzzles are challinging but not frustrating, with a nice difficulty curve. Mechanics and patterns are introduced gradually. 

There are 7 chapters. The first 5 make up the main game. I completed those just within 6 hours. For those who want more, the extra chapter and the expansion chapter introduce each new mechanics. Chapter 6 was by far the most difficult and most time consuming one. The expansion chapter was rather easy and short, but had interesting mechanics.

Con: Controls. With the mouse, you have the swipe etc to control the game. But since, I didn't discover that at first, I used a controller. Now I suck with a controller, but Lara just moved one too many time inside the bite of a cobra unintentionally. There were also responsiveness issues when grabbing an object. But in the end, it didn't distract from the experience too much.

Apparently not that fast, but without guides, or using the game's hint system (except once, which I will regret for ever), I completed the game in about 12 hours. All collectables, all outfits unlocked (which was actually a fun thing to do).

39129565.review:
Lara Croft GO, c'est un petit jeu qui vient de l'univers du mobile ensuite adapté sur PC et consoles. Du coup les graphismes sont simples mais ils ont eu l'idée de faire une direction artistique rendant hommage au rendu graphique des consoles 32 bits. On voit bien les polygones qui constituent les personnages et les environnements, les couleurs et les décors ressortent bien aussi. Le tout reste donc très agréable à l’œil et tourne parfaitement.
Pour ce qui est du jeu en lui même, il s'agit en fait de tour par tour en vue isométrique. On incarne donc Lara Croft dans de nouvelles aventures archéologiques, on en connait le minimum, on est directement lancé dans un temple à explorer. Et ici Lara se déplace donc case par case et au tour par tour, ce n'est absolument pas un RPG mais plus un jeu basé sur des puzzles à résoudre pour avancer. En plus de cela il faut faire avec le ennemis qui eux aussi avancent et agissent au tour par tour. Pour progresser et faire face aux pièges il faut un minimum de réflexion, certaines énigmes demandent même un peu de Die & Retry pour bien comprendre leur mécanique. Au début, la progression et la logique est facile mais plus on avance et plus cela devient retorse, ça joue beaucoup sur les déplacements, un peu comme un jeu d'échec ou de GO (d'où le nom). Le monde de la célèbre exploratrice est toujours aussi accrocheur même au service d'un jeu aussi différent de ses habituelles aventures. Il reste très fidèle à l'esprit exploration/aventure et au monde de Tomb Raider. Ainsi, il vous demandera de trouver toutes les reliques et joyaux cachés dans les différents niveaux pour le finir à 100%. Et pour satisfaire le fan service, chaque relique recomposée donne accès à un costume pour Lara, souvent tiré de ses anciennes aventures. Il y a ainsi une bonne douzaine de costumes différents. Deux aventures complètes ont été rajoutées en mises à jour, ce qui allonge la durée vie du jeu qui monte à un dizaine d'heures. Les nouvelles campagnes sont les plus corsées à ce jour et possèdent leur originalité appréciable vis à vis du jeu original. Elles ajoutent chacune une mécanique de jeu qui complexifie grandement la progression et pousse bien plus à la réflexion et à l'essai. 
Pour finir, le gameplay est dune simplicité extrême car il permet uniquement d'avancer, de pousser/tirer des objets. Pour tuer des ennemis il suffit d'avancer dessus quand ils ne sont pas de face pour les envoyer sous terre. La maniabilité est quand à elle hérité du mobile et demande de cliqué et glissé la souris comme si on l'utilisait tel un écran tactile. Un peu irritant au début mais on s'y fait. En définitive un très bon petit jeu qui ravira les fans de Lara Croft ainsi que les fans de puzzles et jeux de réflexion.

39028794.review:
[i]Lara Croft Go[/i] is an easy to moderately difficult 10-to-15-hour turn-based puzzle game. It shares many similarites with the previous [i]Hitman Go[/i], including many of the same mechanics (although re-cast to different artwork). On the other hand, it is significantly different in a few ways: more beautiful, often stunning scenery; a longer stretch of very easy puzzles before you get to the hard ones; and "gems and relics" which have nothing to do with the puzzles, but which you can find to unlock outfits and achievements.

Overall, these differences make for a less challenging and a more artsy, simple-minded game (compared to Hitman Go). However, I can still recommend it to serious puzzle fans: First, the artwork does make for a great gameplay experience. Second, although enduring the earlier puzzles and finding gems and relics may be tedious, the later very challenging puzzles more than make up for it.

Of course I recommend not using any hints -- they are unnecessary, only there to make the game more accessible.

38909687.review:
A thoroughly enjoyable, if very brief(2-3 hrs), puzzle game. Postition and planning are key. New mechanics are introduced right up until the end. Vases scattered through the levels add a bit of hidden object game(and unlock new outfits for Lara).

[spoiler]The boss battle is right in the sweet spot of tricky and fun, and if you're anything like me you'll get a rush from beating it. Notably, it avoids the trap of placing a real-time boss in a turn-based game. Essentially, the boss follows the same rules as all the other enemies, while adding some interesting twists.[/spoiler]

Graphically speaking, nothing special. Done in a low-poly style to emulate the early Tomb Raiders. For a turn-based game, most of the animations are very fluid, though some go on too long.

Not technically important, but something about this game is very calming. Even when you are stuck on a difficult puzzle, the whole thing feels very serene.

Vanilla review only. I'll play the free add-ons later and update if they change anything.

5/5; would recommend, but be aware of the short length.

38857454.review:
[h1][b]Puntuación:  7 /10 - Bueno[/b][/h1]

[i][b]Atlas del más allá.[/b][/i]

[b]Historia[/b]
No hay historia como tal, es simplemente una aventura de Lara en busca de una reliquia.

[b]Jugabilidad[/b]
Nuestro objetivo se basa en superar cada área, como si de una pista de obstaculos se tratara, con tal de llegar a la casilla marcada con una luz.

Su jugabilidad es un sistema similar al de turnos, es decir, el mapa es una especie de tablero donde tenemos definido los posibles caminos que podemos tomar en forma de casillas, pero estas casillas las compartimos con nuestros enemigos y al mismo tiempo con obstaculos que son permanentes o momentáneos. 

Bastante sencilla y sus puzzles a nivel genérico también, claro esta que a medida que avancemos irán aumentando su dificultad.

Si se nos atraganta un área, siempre podemos optar por la ayuda que básicamente te indica lo que debes hacer, bastante útil, pero no me gusta cuando te has quedado en algún punto avanzado de esa área, la ayuda te obliga a repetir todo desde el principio.

[b]Gráficos[/b]
Low poly. 

Sus gráficos son estilo "low poly", hay que pensar que es un juego diseñado para teléfonos móviles, con un acabado mas que notable.

Aunque claro esta, los gráficos son lo menos importante en este juego. 

[b]Sonido.[/b] 
Esta totalmente traducido al español. 

No hay voces, ni textos durante la partida. No pretende explicar una historia, solo hacernos comer el coco.
Pero aun así el sonido de los efectos es bueno y al mismo tiempo se añade una banda sonora, que nos acompañara durante las partidas, bastante buena.

[i][b]Conclusión:[/b][/i]
Un juego bueno, un juego de puzzles que nos hace pensar que debemos hacer para completar un escenario, aunque creo que no hay muchas variaciones para completar los distintos escenarios, por no decir que ninguna salvo la predefinida; Así que rejugabilidad mas bien poca.

[h1]Recomendado[/h1]

+ Puzzles (Algunos sencillos, otros menos sencillos)
+ BSO

- Control por Joystick (Si intentas ir rápido, es posible que Lara se "confunda" y vaya en una dirección errónea, esto puede provocar que muera y tener que repetirlo)
- Ayuda con pistas, si te has quedado atascado en un punto avanzado.


Plataforma:
- i3 2130 3,4 GHz
- 8 GB RAM
- GTX 960 2GB
- Windows 10

Resolución: 1920 x 1080
Calidad: Alta
FPS: 60
Caídas de fps: 0

38688714.review:
Après avoir le même type de jeu de réflexion au tour par tour avec l'univers d'Hitman, Square Enix propose ici une version rendant hommage à Tomb Raider, particulièrement les premières aventures de Lara Croft.

Durant 5 chapitres (+2 bonus), il s'agit de traverser un niveau en évitant les pièges et les bêtes sauvages. Il faut déterminer le bon parcours, effectuer les bonnes manipulations des divers mécanismes et éviter d'être tué par les ennemis en se déplaçant dans l'environnement selon des tracés qui indiquent la distance qu'on peut parcourir lors de chaque tour. 

Lara doit notamment faire face à des serpents, des crocodiles ou des araignées géantes ; doit veiller aux crevasses et aux pièges mortels ; dispose de pistolets et de lances pour tuer et de torches enflammées pour faire reculer ses opposants. Au fil du jeu, ces divers éléments de gameplay s'ajoutent et se combinent.

Il y a également des trésors dissimulés dans les niveaux sur lesquels il faut tous cliquer pour obtenir le 100% des succès. C'est un peu absurde et ça prolonge juste un peu inutilement la durée de vie s'il faut refaire un niveau pour dénicher un trésor oublié.


J'aime bien ce style de jeu de réflexion. L'univers de Lara Croft est ici bien mis en scène avec les vieux temples abandonnés et les leviers à manipuler et s'adapte naturellement au gameplay. Contrairement à la version Hitman (présentés sous forme de pions dans un jeu de plateau), les personnages sont ici animés et les mouvements de Lara sont ceux qu'elles pouvait effectuer lors de ses premiers jeux. On peut juste regretter que la plupart des niveaux soient trop faciles, souvent parce que la difficulté est très progressive et que chaque élément de gameplay est exploité au maximum de ses possibilités, mais ça reste très plaisant.




Pour les amateurs de réflexion et les fans de Lara. En soldes, c'est carrément une bonne affaire.

2015年最佳移动游戏奖

2015年最佳益智游戏奖[/code]
这是“手游大厂”SE出品的一款解密类游戏，于移动平台移植至PC。
此评测仅代表个人观点，没有任何专业参考价值，如有分歧请持保留意见。

[h1]什么是解谜游戏？[/h1]
最近几年各种各样的解谜游戏，知名的大作也不在少数。诸如《传送门》系列这样的关卡式解谜游戏，或是《德波尼亚》这样的剧情向线索式解谜游戏，甚至连《生化危机7》这样的TPS系列大作，也加入了解谜元素。

解谜类游戏越来越多，掺杂的元素越来越多，让游戏更加丰富、玩法更加多样性。这提高了可玩性，却也混淆了“解谜游戏”这一定义。
越来越多的解谜类游戏不再仅仅需要[b]缜密的思维[/b]，而更加需要[b]行云流水的操作[/b]和[b]敏锐的洞察力[/b]。那么，一款纯粹的解谜游戏需要什么呢？这款游戏告诉了我答案。

从游戏元素上来说，《Lara Croft Go》绝对算得上是一款纯粹的解谜游戏。纯粹到什么地步呢？就像《推箱子》、《汉诺塔》、《华容道》一样纯粹[spoiler]抱歉这是我能找得到的最纯粹的解密游戏了。[/spoiler]这是一款只考验你的思维能力，而完全不需要任何操作、观察力[spoiler]找瓶子的成就不影响主线游戏[/spoiler]，也不需要任何剧情作渲染的游戏。只要你有缜密、理性的逻辑思维能力，就够了。

[h1]怎样才能称为一款优秀的解谜游戏？[/h1]
对于一款能称之为优秀的游戏，需要什么？

[b]※合理的配置要求与流畅度。[/b]对于一款追求画质的3A大作[spoiler]诸如《起源》《NieR》之类的[/spoiler]肯定需要极其优秀的画面，而对应的配置要求也就水涨船高。
而对于一款纯粹的解谜游戏来说，更加亲和大众的配置要求显然更为重要。不管出于什么原因，《Lara Croft GO》的配置要求显然满足绝大多数玩家的硬件配置。

[b]※优秀的可玩性与耐玩性。[/b]其实在这个点上，《Lara Croft GO》做得并不是太好，起码在可玩性上是这样的。
作为一款移动平台移植的游戏，SE却并没有作任何基于PC的优化，仍然使用了鼠标模拟手指滑动操作方式，这并不能带给玩家特别良好的游戏体验。但由于游戏本身操作方式的简单，这并没有带来特别的[b]反人类[/b]的操作难度。
而对于这样纯粹的解谜游戏来说，一周目通关也基本没有了二周目的可能性[spoiler]除非你把玩过的关卡忘了。[/spoiler]所以，耐玩性上也不是太高。

[b]※合理的游戏难度。[/b]不管任何游戏，如果让玩家过于简单便通关，肯定不能算是一款优秀的游戏，就算Gal也不能流程太短不是？而如果太难，让90%以上的玩家都必须查攻略才能通关，却也不能称之为一款优秀的游戏。
而作为一款解谜游戏，《Lara Croft GO》的难度显然是合理的。

[b]※合理的定价。[/b]就算是其他方面再优秀，如果没有合理的定价，也不会有多好的口碑。今年SE的《NieR:Automata》事件就是一个很好的例子，而SE去年的另一款游戏《古墓丽影:崛起》也可以作为正面例子。
对于《Lara Croft GO》这样的小品级游戏来说，“低于40元”的定价显然没有太离谱。

[b]※更多的语言支持。[/b]尽管语言只是形式的载体，但更多的语言支持确实有助于游戏的传播，也能带来更好的口碑。比如SE的《古墓丽影:崛起》支持中文语音，就是一个非常好的例子。
而《Lara Croft GO》也支持了世界上最常用的几种主要语言。并且尽管商店页面说不支持简体中文，但游戏内其实是支持的。

[h1]解谜爱好者&喜加一必选名单[/h1]
不管是从解谜游戏还是喜加一小品级游戏来说，《Lara Croft GO》都对得起它的定价。
原价不亏，打折血赚。

总体评分:8.3/10

38240982.review:
Une petite merveille tout droit sortie de l'esprit labyrinthique des mêmes développeurs derrière le très bon Hitman Go. Mais Lara Croft Go va bien plus loin que son prédécesseur, puisqu'entre les animations sublimes, les environnements qui font plaisir à la rétine et une sorte d'aventure, de mode histoire dont l'intrigue, bien que simple, se dévoile petit à petit, au fur et à mesure de notre progression, nous donnant un réel sentiment... ben de progression justement ! le jeu s'avère être une évolution particulièrement aboutie et surtout extrêment plaisante à jouer !
Attention toutefois, je déconseille fortement ce jeu à tous ceux qui n'auront ni le cerveau, ni la patience de finir les énigmes car ne vous y trompez pas, bien que le jeu soit très simple dans ses premiers niveaux qui servent en fait de tutoriel, le reste voit sa difficulté monter progressivement, si bien que, alors que les premiers niveaux se finissaient entre 30 secondes et 1 minute, les derniers m'ont personnellement durés parfois plus d'un quart d'heure !!
Je ne me considère pas comme idiot, juste comme très entêté, c'est pourquoi j'ai dévoré le jeu en une semaine par courtes sessions (une session de jeu par chapitre environ) et sans JAMAIS avoir utilisé les soluces. Au final, ayant terminé tous les chapitres et ayant débloqué tous les succès (qui rassurez-vous ne sont pas chiants pour un sous), j'ai au compteur 11 heures de jeu.

Sinon que dire de plus ? Je trouve son prix (10€ à l'heure où j'écris cette évaluation) honnête, ce qui correspond grosso modo à 1€ l'heure de jeu, franchement ça se vaut et puis de toutes façons, sa qualité justifie complètement son achat, vous ne pouvez pas être déçus si ce genre de jeux vous plaît !
Sautez sur l'occasion ou sinon attendez les soldes (je l'avais acheté soldé perso), mais jouez-y ABSOLUMENT ! Ce chef d'oeuvre tant en terme de visuel que de jouabilité ne doit pas rester aussi peu connu !!!

Sur ce j'espère que cette évaluation (ma toute première sur Steam) vous a été utile et vous souhaite bon jeu, et bon vent !!
Allez allez c'est fini cassez-vous maintenant, on achète le jeu, allez ! :3

It runs on the Unity engine, but seems pretty smooth and obviously being turn-based, framerate isn't much of a concern. (Extremely sparse graphical option menu though, which I think is common to Unity games?)

37901662.review:
"Lara Croft GO" is a second tier casual title in an IP (Intellectual Properety) that provides bread and butter for it's owners.  It's a puzzle game.  It is neither the flaghsip in it's own IP (Tomb Raider), nor in it's own genre (puzzle games).  It's small, inexpensive, and you'd expect it to be unremarkable.  In fact, you'd expect to regret spending money on it.  You won't.  So long as you enter with modest expectations, you'll be pleasently surprised.


We're all familiar with over-hyped, big ticket, media saturating releases of games from flaghsip video game franchises for well established industry giants.  (They'd be as overinflated as that sentence if it weren't for the money and effort poured into them.)

We're also all familiar with the bug-ridden, trouble-strewn path those releases can take when post release support is yanked after a less than stellar launch.  Instead of honing a product that will continue to "sit on store shelves" for 5 to 20 years, and pull in money the whole time, the funding runs dry when the product doesn't perform like a summer blockbuster at the cineplex.  Unless it's a record shattering success upon release, all the money, time, and effort invested so far give next to no return.  It's doomed, because the people who do buy it can't even play it.

In that environment, a small, rather modest game released under just such a flagship IP (Intellectual Property)), "Lara Croft GO," would seem insignificant.  Its not.

Movie, comic book, and cartoon franchises often aim to score big money by cashing in with minimal effort spent on developing an actual product worth buying.  Often times the cost of the IP license is so great, the production, and it is a production, is hurt where it can least afford it: development.

We're also familiar with the results.  Cheap mobile games, (which rake in gobs of cash because, well, there's no justice in the world), lowsy ports, and products that are hobbled in concept as well as execution to save on development costs.  Games that feel like the digital equivelant of an RC car that drives forward, or turns to the left in reverse.  (I hated those cars.  Hated.)

And, of course, the bug-ridden, trouble-strewn path of a big ticket, flagship IP product when post-release support is yanked due to a disappointing launch.

"Lara Croft GO" manages to buck the trend successfully.  While it's IP's primary products, "Tomb Raider" and "Rise of the Tomb Raider," are incredibly healthy, it complements the line by not undermining it's perception of quality.  And I would wager it does it at a tiny fraction of the cost.

And that's the key.  When the all consuming bottom line is king, making a quality product with a limited budget is usually more than anyone can handle.

Glory projects gone awry, cheap mobile games, and the infernal franchise cash grab still populate the store shelves.  When someone says "Lets make a game of," they come up with incredible concepts.  But by the time they purchase the license, they seem to have money left to run the lights, coffee machine, and play video games.  Not make them.  The other extreme is a mobile game that charges $2 to accelerate a 12 hour (real-life time) in-game process that took 50 seconds in the 90's.

In between is where most franchise IP titles land.  They know the license is expenisive, they count their beans, make the most stunningly beautiful game they can, and pay the janitor, utilities, and game designer with what's left over.  The product is limited both in execution and concept.  (Ports? Janitor.)



This particular game managed to escape that fate.  Obviously it's not a fully realized "Tomb Raider" game.  Nor is it a fully realized puzzle game.  Instead of pouring time and money into this ancillary product, they made a smaller, shorter, less expensive game that delivers a better play experience than we're used to.  The result is a small game from a big franchise that isn't broken or doomed.



The key was they limited both scope and concept, so that they could follow through fully in execution.

In concept its a puzzle game, based on GO.  Limited to movement in four directions.  Three basic actions available: move, use lever, or interact with object.  Locked off camera (I don't think you can rotate it), 3/4 isometric.

In scope, it's got around 8 chapters, with each split into about 10 short levels.  One trinket to raid per chapter, one new outfit per trinket. 4 different cave environments, about 1 to 2 enemy types each.  About 6 interactable objects throughout.  Art is somewhat low-poly intentionally.

In execution it shines.  It becomes an adventure game that evokes the fun of playing one of the original Tomb Raider games, if it were a board game.  The levels are easy to solve, but enjoyable.  There are a few head scratching moments.  There's a steady stream of small challenges, and a surprising degree of replay value.

Like the old Super Mario Bros. games on NES and SNES, it plays with the concept of exploring the world, (in this case spellunking), to unlock areas of the overworld (a main passageway) that you can see but not yet reach.

Along the way you collect pieces of lost sculpture, jewelry, and gems.  The levels play like diaramas, where everything is there for a reason, and the puzzle is in figuring out how to use each piece properly.  There's sufficient freedom to manuever through the levels, so you don't feel keyboard claustrophobia.

Art wise, it evokes a limited pallete of colors, like a 256 color display, but renders it in natural lighting.  Fire, water, shrubbery, stonework, pottery, are all executed in a simple style that's rendered beautifully.  Animations are fluid and satisfying.  Lara herself is cleverly portrayed in a variety of outfits that evoke her classic original outings.  Simplistic by todays big ticket standards, but far ahead of her original polygons.

And that's the key to this game.  Artful simplicity that belies the degree of quality.  Its a small game that knows its small and makes the most of it.  Its a short inexpensive game that plays longer than you expected, and makes you feel like you got your money's worth.  Its a pretty game, that implies more than is there, and then begins to deliver.  Its a puzzle game, that manages to transport you into a storybook-like adventure.  Except you get to see the caves, and giant spiders, and the Tomb Raider herself.  At her finest.

37073133.review:
Неожиданно для меня Lara Croft GO оказалась игрой с большой буквы, пришедшая на ПК с телефонов и планшетиков. В ней хорошо всё, начиная от минималистичного визуального стиля – угловатого и немного мультяшного, который органично смотрится как на маломощных мобильных девайсах и так же симпатично выглядит на ПК, не вызывая ощущения будто ты играешь в игру для мобилок.
Аудио и звук в Lara Croft GO тоже на высоте. Фанаты Ларисы Тамбовской наверняка прослезятся, когда услышат знакомые сэмплы, а воздушный, иногда напряжённый эмбиентовый саундтрек от Pixel Audio (который можно скачать бесплатно, да еще и в WAV здесь: http://www.tombraiderhq.com/archives/2015-10-30-Lara-Croft-GO-Complete-OST ) будет погружать вас в ту самую, проёбаную в перезапуске атмосферу приключения и исследования из уже классических частей серии. Как ни странно, но пошаговая система и пиксельхантинговый поиск частей артефактов на уровне приходятся игре как никак кстати. Забавно, что этой маленькой мобильной игре удалось сделать то, чего не вышло сделать у её “большой” сестры. Видно, что люди, делавшие Lara Croft GO любят классические игры серии и бережно отнеслись к наследию, перенеся дух приключения и оставив игрокам немало фансервиса (сэмплы, анимации и классические костюмы с трёхполиглнальными сиськами Лары и главная менюшка). Тут даже сюжет есть с отлично анимированными катсценками в начале и конце главы, всё как положено. Что касается пазлов, то они не надоедают до самого конца игры (у меня на полное прохождение ушло 12,5 часов) а с каждым уровнем их сложность возрастает, появляются новые механики/предметы с которыми нужно взаимодействовать для решения головоломок.
Без шуток Lara Croft GO одна из лучших частей Tomb Raider и определённо лучшая из серии «Lara Croft»

36579835.review:
Thank you to the developers at SE Montreal and the publisher SquareEnix for creating a really fun puzzle game for me to escape, enjoy and most importantly think.

Lara Craft GO i believe is the 2nd entry in the now successful GO series. It continues the success by placing you in everyone's favorite female explorer, Lara Croft. The game channels early Tomb Raider adventures and captures some gaming magic along the way.

Lara Craft Go is simple in design and just when you think you have it figured along comes a puzzle that will stump you to the core. The game is broken into 6 chapters(including DLC) and each chapter has about 9+ levels with 2-4 puzzles per chapter. It's a lot of content but the puzzle area is small so you seem to constantly be moving forward. 

As you begin your adventure your goal will be to enter a tomb and escape out the exit with the treasure without being snakebit, mauled by lizards, crushed by boulders or speared by ...spears. Along the path you will move pillars, jump and climb to avoid dangers while also looking for collectibles which will unlock some classic outfits for Lara. In the world you move one square at a time(left click swipe in direction) as do all creatures simultaneously. Everything acts different so learning patterns is the key. Most of the puzzles range from easy to medium difficulty but you will occasionally run into some absolute brain melters. Luckily there is a hint system built into the game that is easily accessible from a small icon in the left corner. While a lot of puzzle games continue to progress the game with difficulty LC:GO maintains a level keel throughout the game which i appreciated.

Graphically Lara Craft:GO looks terrific. The game is played from an 2.5 isometric view with a painting aesthetic that makes Lara and the various environments look sharp. Background music is done well and has enough tracks to keep it fresh though most of the playthrough.   

A rare game that could turn non puzzle players into fans of the genre, Lara craft Go is a huge success. The game is practically everywhere on every device and deserving of the amount of positive reviews and this is just another telling you what you already know, yea it’s pretty good. 

Played on my MSI ApachePro laptop 1080P max settings no problems

Positives

Good Puzzle game, not too easy or too difficult
Excellent use of the Tomb Raider license
The right amount of content 
Lots of variety of enemies, environments
No Hud, looks beautiful
Achievements attainable without guides
Hint button 

Negatives

No keyboard controls

35728262.review:
After the excellent Hitman GO, it would have been trivial to follow up with another game in a similar gameboard based world, just putting in the certainly much more attracrive Lara in place of 47. However, Square Enix Montreal took the high road, and ended up with something much more, and also much less... at least it looked like that for quite a while. Bear with me, this review is going to be of the long-a**ed persuasion.

By taking the high road, I mean that SqEM invented a completely different environment for the turn-based puzzles of Lara Croft GO. They chose to look like an old-school platform game set in 3D, surreptitiously inserting visual extras like dynamic lighting and smoothed edges into the decidedly low-poly environment. As a result, the game's more closed-in spaces look simply very good, and then they open to beautiful vistas, sometimes containing not-yet-seen (or already seen) parts of the environments. The jungle / cave complex is rather static, so it's all the more intense when some action like unfriendly animals or giant boulders happen. Massively adding to the atmosphere are the excellent sounds like gates crashing down behind, underlining the impossibility of going back, or the restrained soundtrack that's maybe more a soundscape. In short, the game provides one of the best "being there" feeling I've ever encountered, and it's pure joy to walk through the game's levels, basically uninterrupted...
...uh oh. Here's the one problem: the game is very easy. The levels of first two episodes are hardly more than walkabouts, and while the next two need a bit more thinking, they're still not harder than Hitman GO's levels. If you remember, HG provided brain excercise via extra objectives, which are completely missing from LCG. Yeah, you need to find hidden vases. Duh. So by the time you finish the four original chapters, you'll have the feeling of having completed a really superb walking simulator. And then, there are the extra episodes.

Cave of Fire starts out with a clever gamechanging mechanic - most of the unfriendlies are made of lava, and they revive after a few rounds. Maybe having anticipated my lines above, SqEM significantly ramped up the difficulty in the first extra episode, and as a result, the levels are very satisfying almost without exception.
And finally, there's the Mirror of Spirits, the second expansion. This one again focuses more on the exploration, there are few puzzles as good as the CoF levels, but atmosphere-wise, it manages to improve on the already fantastic base game, especially when Mirror-Lara enters the picture. And that final image with the Mirror... wow.

Lara Croft GO has done one of the best jobs of building atmosphere and creating immersion I've ever seen in a computer game, setting an excellent example that visual design is much more important than technical brute force in graphics. The easy early levels provide with a superb sense of adventure, while the Cave of Fire requires some heavy brain work. One of my favourite games from the last few years.

Новая [b]Ларочка[/b] с подзаголовком [b]“GO”[/b] представляет собой изометрический [b]Puzzle-Adventure[/b], где нам нужно в пошаговом режиме преодолевать препятствия, состоящие из различных механизмов, ловушек и противников, обдумывая каждый свой шаг на перед и попутно собирая древние реликвии.

[h1]+ Плюсы[/h1]

[list]
 [*]Прекрасная, очень атмосферная музыка.
 [*]Красивейшая визуальная часть.
 [*]Множество секретов и костюмов.
 [*]Интуитивное управлении – проблем вообще никогда не бывает.
 [*]Разнообразные уровни.
 [*]Не напрягающие своей сложностью головоломки, от них не хочется лезть на стену – наоборот решить самому не используя встроенные в игру подсказки.
[/list]

[h1]- Минусы[/h1]

[list]
[*]Небольшая продолжительность, где-то часа [b]4-5[/b] – но тут есть два [b]DLC[/b] с более высокой сложностью, которые проходятся по времени как основная компания.
[*]Игра, полностью немая и лишенная сюжета – но всё-таки так и было задумано и ей это нисколько не вредит.
[*]Даже не знаю, у меня на данный момент есть только одна претензия… разработчики, давайте новую часть.
[/list]

[b]P.S.[/b] В игре есть [b]Русский язык[/b], только вот [b]Square Enix[/b] почему-то об этом умалчивает.

Всем неравнодушным к [b]Ларочке[/b] и жанру, настоятельно рекомендую.

First a mobile game, then translated to PC, using the mouse as a finger touching the screen, this is a puzzle game using the Lara Croft theme.  If you played Hitman GO, you know the puzzle type. 33755858.review:
A turn-based puzzle game featuring an iconic video game heroine. Overall a very enjoyable experience.

PROS:
* Challenging - The mechanics start simple enough, maybe even too easy, but as the game progresses some of the puzzles are quite challenging. In terms of difficulty, there’s plenty of “meat” for die-hard puzzle fans like me, but there’s also an in-game hinting system if you’re looking for a more casual experience. (I didn’t try the hinting, so can’t comment on it further.)
* Atmosphere - The graphics and sound effects are spot on. They create a captivating ambience without being distracting.

CONS:
* User Interface - The game was clearly a port from a tablet game and a tablet is still the ideal medium to play this game. With a mouse it’s click-and-drag to move Lara to each space, which is tiring considering the amount of movement. Movement with the stick of a game controller is easier, but at times didn’t feel precise enough. I mostly used a controller, but there were a few places where I switched to a mouse, when I found using the controller would send Lara down a different path than the one I intended.

OTHER CONSIDERATIONS:
* Short - I was able to 100% the game in under 10 hours. The puzzles don’t change, so there’s not much replay value. It was a satisfying experience that didn’t feel incomplete, but the length nevertheless ought to be a consideration before purchase.

33405839.review:
Lara Croft GO is very much in the same vein of turn based puzzle goodness that Hitman GO was. The difference to me is that while Hitman GO tends to feel like a set piece each time albeit in a claustraphobic environment, Lara Croft GO feels more like actual exploration of a tomb. This is largely due to the background artwork which fills each level which is accentuated by the removal of the pieces on a board look used in Hitman GO. The music and sound effects are still amazingly done as was in Hitman GO. The core puzzle gameplay remains a strong point in the GO series.

The 'hint' system is actually a solution system because the Steam version has unlimited hints. There are no settings to limit this so using a hint is pretty much like asking for the solution unless you quit the puzzle and re-enter after you've seen what you need to know. The UI could be improved but it works fine the way it is. Some possible improvements would be putting arrows to indicate you can select levels (when replaying to search for collectibles) or showing the relic / gem count in the pause menu.

Finally, just like Hitman GO this doesn't support the keyboard sadly so it's probably a lot easier / comfortable to play with a controller (or touchscreen if that's supported?).

33309209.review:
In the first few minutes of playing this, I thought it was absolute rubbish! Why on earth would you want a Tomb Raider adventure without the ability to run, jump, or shoot enemies at a fast pace? Why on earth would you want a turn based puzzle game?

Once I'd worked out how to move Lara (dragging the mouse to the next square, which is tedious and could have been done so much better with arrow keys as well), I slowly got hooked.

You move Lara around a series of obstacles and enemies, each with their own properties to complete the level. The introduction of different objects and moves is done very nicely (you usually get to practice something before you need it). You can collect gems and relics to unlock outfits - nice to see some of the classics back again, although some of the other choices are a little baffling (presumably the same developer is responsible for the games mentioned?).

The only criticism could really be the puzzles. If you're a consummate puzzler who likes tearing your hair out at every opportunity (i.e. Hare in the Hat) then you might find this all too easy. If you want a fairly casual game with some fairly intuitive puzzles which will nevertheless take you a couple of tries to get right, then this is for you.

A bit of a bizarre departure for Lara, but one I really quite enjoyed.

[h1] Hitman GOに続き、Tomb Raiderシリーズからスピンオフしたターン制パズル [/h1] 

主人公をグリッドに沿って動かしていき、遺跡の出口まで導くというゲーム。

リアルタイム要素はなく、どのルートをたどってどのオブジェクトをどの順番で利用していくか、とにかくじっくり考えさせられる。
落とし穴や矢を打ち出すトラップを上手く回避し、行く手を阻むモンスターを倒し、石柱やスイッチなどのオブジェクトを移動させ、上手くルートを切り開いていく。
最初のうちは簡単だが、終盤になると通路を行きつ戻りつ、難解な詰め将棋を解くごとく正しい手順を辿らなければならない。

ちなみに今作ではHitman GOのようなボードゲーム的な演出がなくなり、パズルとしての中身もガラリと変わった印象。
前作ではいかにガードを回避するかという点が最大の問題だったが、道を塞ぐオブジェクトを押したり引いたりする要素が加わったことで、『倉庫番』のような思考が要求されるようになった。

またパズルを解くまでの手順数がカウントされず、チャレンジ要素もなくなったため、ややシンプルになった印象を受ける。
ただし、パズルとしての難易度が低いというわけではない。

33006080.review:
Lara Croft GO is amazingly good for what was originally a smartphone game.

To start off, I'd like to say that this game offers a curiously relaxing experience, with its chill music and beautiful, stylized environments. And that's what sets this game apart, really. It gives off a very comfortable atmosphere.

The gameplay is about going through different stages while managing Lara's position to avoid enemies and environmental traps, all the while manipulating contraptions or making use of the unique characteristics of each stage to be able to progress. The level of challenge is just right since the game carefully introduces new mechanics in easy levels, then develops them in harder ones.

It's "turn based" in the sense that the world only moves forward when Lara moves forward, giving you as much time as you need to think things through.

There are also some collectibles hidden in the stages if you wanna go pixel hunting to unlock new clothes for Lara. If you find a golden vase hidden anywhere, you click it to discover a relic or a gem. It's a neat little bonus.

Recommended for anyone who wants a simple, relaxing and extremely well crafted experience.

32219165.review:
[b]Lara Croft GO 5/5:[/b] Je neskonale smutné, že z mobilů portovaný „indie“ puzzle pohrobek Tomb Raidera zachycuje ducha série lépe a věrněji než jakýkoli regulérní díl za poslední dekádu a půl. Square Enix Montréal totiž Laru vrací do míst, kde jí to sluší zdaleka nejvíce. Tedy do zatuchlých exotických kobek plných pokladů, kam lidská noha po staletí nevkročila a když vkročila tak o život některou z důmyslných pastí přišla… To je koncept, který hlavní série opustila v neprospěch samoúčelné akce pro akci a který pohříchu postupně opustili všichni Indyho videoherní nástupci; ať již Lara či Drake.

 Titul, u kterého na první pohled zaujme čarokrásná vizuální stránka (bez nadsázky co obrazovka, to materiál hodný umístění na plochu), ale naštěstí to u ní ani zdaleka nekončí, jelikož tahové puzzly samotné a hratelnost nezaujmou o nic méně. Ne vše se zadařilo bez mušek. Kupříkladu obtížnost je… No, ryze „mobilní“. Tedy nic moc náročného a maximálně po pár minutách rozlousknete sebezapeklitější problém (nutno přiznat, že těch vyloženě zapeklitých tu je pomálu a navíc je tu vždy možnost nápovědy). Je tu spousta nápaditých variací na základní mechaniky a co pár levelů to představení nového konceptu, který se však zdaleka ne vždy zadaří přetavit ve skutečnou výzvu a tak nejeden nápad je sice skrze nenásilný a skvěle intergrovaný tutorial představen, ovšem záhy se odporoučí a nic pořádného z něj neplyne. Neplatí to ani zdaleka o všech, ale o mnohých ano a je to škoda. O alespoň nějaké obtížnosti se dá mluvit až u první ze dvou bonusových kapitol. Výše uvedené ovšem neznamená, že by šlo o úplně krátkou blbuvzdornou záležitost, jelikož herní doba se i tak pohybuje kolem osmi hodin. Navíc je různorodá a tak vám chvíli vám závity potrápí (no, spíše polechtá) posunování pilířů, jindy pohybové vzorce nepřátel a poté třeba zrcadlová dualita akcí.

 Výsledkem je hra se specifickým (a nádherným) vizuálem, skvělým konceptem, nápady i hratelností a důkaz, že levoboček v podobě spin offu slavné série nejen že nemusí být nutně přiživováním se na slovutném jménu, ale že může být neporovnatelně lepší svého předobrazu. Pokud už tedy máte plné zuby abstraktních hlavolamů a puzzlů, tak Lara Croft GO nabízí více než dobrou alternativu puzzle hry s tématikou, která představovat místy větší výzvu, tak by jí nebylo už vůbec co vytknout.

Absolutely awesome, my favourite entry in SqEnix's GO series!

From the way the main menu is designed to the mechanics and even unlockable costumes, you can really tell the devs were big fans of the original Core Design Tomb Raider games.

If you like the GO games mechanics or like Tomb Raider, I would definitely get it. 

Some of the puzzles are a bit easy, some I've spent quite some time on (especially the recent new free campaign), but if you're impatient you can always use hints. Compared to other games in the series it also doesn't have the "complete the level in under 15 turns" challenges which I disliked and the environment aesthetics are gorgeous.

Regarding how it plays on PC - I own both Hitman and Deus Ex GOs on my phone and I actually prefer having a bigger screen for these games. You have to click and drag to move Lara around on PC though but you get used to it pretty quickly.

The only complaint is that I would love to see more levels, 100%'d the game in two sittings and now there's not much to do, sadly.

Well worth the full price, imo.

結合冒險、解謎與戰棋玩法，Lara Croft Go，非常好的把之前Hitman Go的缺點都修飾完畢，使得本作在解謎之餘，又不會顯得單調無聊，並且冒險帶點刺激的劇情，讓解謎之餘，更有一種奇妙的帶入感，相當精采。

關於本作的內容部分，可細分為幾個章節，而每章節又分為幾個小節，每小節又分為幾個小區域，整個遊戲雖然看似長度不長，但關卡數目卻非常非常多，囊括了各種道具、怪物與陷阱的運用，就算不太清楚怎麼進行，也有提示可以讓你通關，而中後期的解謎也需要多次思考才能打通，我覺得無論在各方面都達到了佳作的極限，可惜依舊不具備重玩性，但不失為解謎的代表作之一。

免費的幾個全新章節也誠意滿滿，在打折後，我覺得價位完全超越解謎的概念設計與美術的部分，非常令人印象深刻，很推薦給喜愛解謎的玩家遊玩。

30915132.review:
无意间看主播玩过，感觉不错就入手了，
先说优点
1，画面精美，对于一个解密游戏来说，画面肯定是关注的重点，这个游戏并没有让我失望，整个过程光影，3D，模型都很精致流畅，而且风格靠近古墓靓影，女主还有好几个模型可换，很不错
2，操作简单易懂，整个过程的操作只有点击和拖动，女主走那边是通过拖动来控制的，而触动开关和投矛是点击，从操作上来说，中规中矩，没有明显的缺漏也没有眼前一亮的创意，但是就是这样的操作我觉得恰到好处，用最简单的操作做自己的选择
3，解谜友好且无限复活，对于手和脑都有点残的玩家来说，这款游戏很值得入手（打折最好原价勉强），我是打折买的，但是这个解谜仍然很不错，前几关很简单，氛围也做的很好，最后面的几关就需要一点思考了，由于是一步一动（就是女主是按照特定的路线，每次走一格，场景会跟着女主改变），所以每一步都需要考虑，一步走错直接拜拜，总的来说难度适中，新手还是老鸟都可以找到自己的位置
接下来说一下缺点（特色？？）
1，声音方面稍显平庸，没有很出色，虽然营造氛围的目的已经达到，但是我觉得这样一个操作画面解谜俱佳的游戏里，音乐应该更进一步
2，中途略显单调，虽然这个游戏节奏紧凑（短…），情节连环，但是中途关卡略多，且风格单一还是会让玩家感到一丝乏味（或许是我耐心不够？），这条有点牵强，但是因为游戏好才会提出更高的要求，对吧？
3，重玩性不够高，收集模式略显蛋疼，首先，重玩性对于解谜游戏来说，本来就是硬伤，虽然这款游戏已经做到了业界平均以上的水平，但是我还是想说：你快点出第二部啊啊啊，不然评测就会用这个来给你差评啊啊啊。好吧，接下来是收集模式，这个游戏的收集模式真的很蛋疼（特色？），你要在解谜的过程里不断的注意每一步场景变化后的各个细节，以找到用来解锁女主形象的罐子，我只想说这个设定真是太棒了，让我流着泪又重玩了一遍（明明是好多遍啊啊啊，难道这是制作商为了强行提高重玩性？？？），所以大家入坑记得找罐子……（这个机制是仁者见仁智者见智，说不上好坏，也就不评价了）
总的来说，这是一部优秀的解谜游戏，有点很多，缺点一般你看不到，所以推荐入手9.4/10，原价入手也不亏，打折5块是小赚，打折10块果断入手，打折20？我靠你还不去坑？你是要上天么？

A Tomb Raider themed boardgame-like puzzle game. Yep, that's what it is. Have a look at the screenshots and you will get a good idea of the kind of puzzles it has.

The game itself is a no-effort port from a mobile-phone game. There is no other control method than "swipe" with your mouse: drag your mouse up/down/left/right then release. There is no saving. So if you have to leave the game unexpectedly and return to the game, you could end up restarting the whole chapter or restarting the puzzle. I never figured out why the game does or doesn't save your progress.

The graphics are simple but good, the backgrounds are detailed, the music & sound are good.  Lara Croft Go is a worthwhile purchase only when it is on sale for half price or cheaper.

30736119.review:
[h1]Simple but brilliant minimalist Tomb Raider.[/h1]

The puzzles are easy to pick up but very enjoyable to complete, the low-poly graphics are beautiful, the lo-fi ambient electronic music completes the atmosphere, and everything is presented with an impressive finish.

The game itself is a series of turn-based movement puzzles on a grid. As long as you stand still nothing happens; when you move a square enemies and traps respond. Different enemies have different behaviors like chess pieces, and new puzzle mechanics and modifiers are gradually introduced. There's also some pixel hunting for treasures that unlock special outfits for Lara (most of them from the classic games.)

The main campaign is relatively short and easy, but fun all the way through, and some of the later levels are pretty satisfying when you figure them out. They even managed to do a clever boss fight which is kind of impressive for a puzzle game. The two additional chapters are significantly more challenging and without using hints took me a lot longer to complete than the base game.

All in all Lara Croft GO is an enjoyable puzzler with great production values well worth the time.

30634788.review:
Go,Lara Croft.

劳拉终其作为游戏形象的一生，都在完成违反物理学的各种奇迹。不如说一直都在奔跑着，老姐奔跑着的时间可要比隔壁那个和说唱歌手同名的家伙活跃在舞台上的时间长得多了。

在这款从手机移植过来的游戏里，Lara Croft也在一如既往的奔跑着。就像其他GO系列里面EIDOS的其他角色一样，移动，基于格子顶点的移动，是GO系列一直的核心。（DEUS EX GO并不太相同，但大致都可以认为是从结点到结点的移动）。

GO系列出色的点在于他将很多时候玩家所要采取的策略反应到选择简单的移动路径上面来。除了一些推石柱，还有最后才加上的计时器这样的额外交互，诸如过刀阵，绕蜥蜴之类的活儿，都可以纯粹依靠劳拉姐精妙的走位达成。尤其是在手机上，这种简单的操作模式，有着巨大的意义。操作逻辑的统一极大简化了玩家上手的门槛。但GO系列最大的缺点，也在于这种内核延展性的贫弱，一旦上升游戏的难度，由于可视范围的受限，大型关卡不可能在这种空间展开，“复杂”的机关很容易让游戏变成穷举游戏，而且在这种基于结点移动的棋盘上，穷举的方法并不十分直观，在操作轻量化的背面让人不免有疲劳感，包括相对鸡肋的收集系统，但游戏毕竟是手游，游戏时长不长，结合艺术氛围的切换，玩家还是基本能打完这款游戏的，更不用提喜欢玩PUZ的玩家了。

[h1]以上是正文，下面是比较没有用的倒推分析[/h1]

前一作Hitman GO同样采用了GO机制，却并没有像劳拉这款一样成为苹果力推的大作，固然有营销和SE策略的改变，但其本质还是有可以分析的地方。

劳拉在冒险中遇见的，毕竟是无生命的障碍，且更多是一种符号化的体现，刀锋阵，石头柱虽然怎么看都一个模样，但因为常年来的文化印象积累，不会让人觉得过于突兀，相反还与IP有一定的衔接性。与之相比，HITMAN也许给潜入玩家用棋盘的方式也不错，但机械化的行为总是会让人感觉”出戏“的。就像为什么新一部杀手第一季出来大家抱怨的是AI，吹的是叙事。当一个世界玩具感过于强烈，往往会削弱这个东西里面认真的部分，因为怎么看都是玩儿，不是吗？

i did not play hitman go before this one so i was new to the concept. impressive how neat a game you can build using the unity engine and somewhat limited resources. basically during gameplay i had two revelations:

30438823.review:
[h1]日本語対応済[/h1]

[h1]ターン制パズルゲーム[/h1]
簡単なアクションも難しいアクションは一切無し、必要なのはパズルを解く思考のみ。
詰まってもゲーム内ヒント[strike](というか答え)[/strike]を使えばOK。
ヒント使用で取れなくなる実績は無く、実績のみ欲しい人にも安心設計。

元はスマホ向けゲームとしてリリースされたトゥームレイダーシリーズの一作だ。
ムービーやSSを見てもらえれば分かるだろうが、敢えてカクカクポリゴンを使っておりPSの頃を想起させる雰囲気ゲームの側面も有る。
シリーズ物の一作ではあるが、前作との繋がりは無く主人公と秘境探索という骨格のみを共有しているだけの別ゲーと見てなんら問題は無い。

操作は、元々スマホ向けに作られているためドラッグ＆ドロップとクリックでストレスが無いように作られている。
また、ゲームパッド操作も可能だ。(ただ、カメラ位置の都合でマス目が斜めになっており、パッドだとたまに誤操作することも)

全6章[b](2017年3月3日のアップデートで＋1章で全7章)[/b]有り、ボリュームは値段相当。
半額セール時に買えれば、尚更ボリュームが有るように感じるだろう。

各章の最初に新ギミックを使ったチュートリアル的なステージを経るため、親切なステージ構成になっている。
パズルの難易度については、前半の簡単なパズルからステージが進むに連れて悩む場面が出てくる難易度のパズルも有る。
ただ、前記したようにヒント機能が有り、どうしようもなくなった時はそれに頼ってしまえばいい。
ヒント機能は途中で切ることができるため試行錯誤中の自分の選択が正しいかだけの確認にも使える。
敵に攻撃されたり穴に落ちたりするものの、ゲームオーバーは無く、直前からリスタートするため気楽にトライ＆エラーできるのも良い。

収集要素としてステージ中に壺が隠されており、それにカーソル(パッドなら右スティック)を合わせることで隠しアイテムが手に入る。
各ステージで全ての隠しアイテムを入手することでコスチュームと実績を入手することが可能だ。
これもパズル難易度と同じくして後半になるにつれて隠し方が巧妙になってくる。
どうしても分からない時はコミュニティガイドに動画が有るので、それを参照すればいいだろう。

ターン制パズルの完成度は高く、パズルゲーム好きならきっと気に入るはずだ。

I’ve played the mobile game for several hours, and am basically basing this review off of that experience, since this is identical, as far as I can see.

In short, Lara Croft GO is the best Tomb Raider game since TR Legend. There is none of that forced story bullshit, but simply great graphics, great puzzles, and a rock solid atmosphere.
They've managed to boil twenty years of innovation, questionable sexualising of a digital woman, and several different attempts at renewing a franchise into a concentrated soup of excellence. This game is both casual and hardcore at the same time, nostalgic and forward looking at the same time. If this had come out on Amiga in 1991 it would already be a classic, but I have no doubt it will be considered one 25 years from now.

10/10 would play even on Amiga.

30400139.review:
Lara Croft GO is a turn based puzzle game based on the Tomb Raider franchise. Each level is divided into a grid, and you move Lara one space at a time. You’ll need to pull levers and push stone pillars to weigh down pressure plates to trigger moving platforms and open doors, while avoiding giant spiders and snakes, crumbling floor tiles, boulders and arrow traps.

The good

-	Most of the puzzles are intelligently designed. Solving them gave me that “I’m the smartest guy in the world!” feeling.
-	The last couple of chapters get quite complex and challenging, without feeling frustrating.
-	The game does a good job of teaching the player the rules.
-	Every level has hidden gems and relics to find.
-	It took me 8 hours to finish each level and find about 80% of the hidden loot, which represents good value for money.
-	I didn’t suffer from any bugs or crashes.

The bad

-	Occasionally the puzzle mechanics don’t make sense with real world logic. You aren’t allowed to simply wait or stand still for a turn, which has an impact on some of the later puzzles that have a timed element. Also, Lara’s guns can only be used in very specific situations (you can’t shoot an enemy that is more than 1 tile away). Sometimes you can’t move to a tile that is next to the one you’re standing on, just because there’s no line on the floor connecting them. Of course there’s always a solution, but you have to be willing to accept that you can’t do the obvious thing and find a way to work within the limitations of the game’s rules.
-	I would have really liked an undo move option. Sometimes I’d get almost to the end of the level and realise I’d made one simple mistake which made the level unbeatable, and I’d have to start again from the beginning.
-	If you get totally stuck, there is an option for a “hint”, but this actually tells you the solution to the entire puzzle rather than giving you a small clue.
-	No story or dialogue. I need more Camilla Luddington!
-	Keyboard and mouse controls are horrible. You move by clicking and dragging, which is probably an attempt to recreate the feel of a mobile phone touch screen. You can’t use wasd or arrows or any other keys to move. After a couple of levels of that abomination, I switched to using my 360 controller, which actually controls how you’d expect a game to control (push the stick to move in a direction, use A/X/Y to interact with objects).

The recommendation

If you enjoyed the puzzle solving aspects of main franchise games like Anniversary and Underworld, and you own a gamepad, you should enjoy Lara Croft GO.

Lara Croft GO is a puzzle game, that was ported from mobile devices. Surprisingly, it runs well, and even though it was made for mobile devices, the gameplay suits the PC well. One could argue whether there is a story or not, but for the most part there are only puzzles.

The puzzles are interessting, and get progressivly more difficult as new elements are introduced, and later combined. So if you are into puzzle games, you might want to give it a try. For the most part the puzzles are smart, and as long as you are somewhat smart you should be able to clear the main game pretty easily. The DLCs however ups the difficulity a notch, however, should you get stuck, you should know there is a hint system in place.

I do recommend the game, but I do dislike the fact that some of the more difficult puzzles can't be solved in multiple ways. In the beginning it's all about understanding how the mechanics work, and putting them together to solve the puzzles. This feels great, but towards the end of the game, it seems like you need to solve the puzzle the exact way the developer made it. It seems it's more about timing the boulder and the creatures rather than solving a genuine puzzle. One misstep, and you need to restart. This will lead to some frustrations. Except for that it's a decent game. Pick it up at a sale.

一見するとアクションゲームのようですが、実は非リアルタイムなパズルゲームで、いわゆるターンベースというものになっています。
スゴロクのようなマス目の道を適切なルートで進むとクリア、間違うとハマリまたは死亡というシンプルなデザインで、1面あたりのマップも小さくお手頃です。
ルートには様々な敵や仕掛けが配置されていて、対応の順番を誤るとハマるため、先々まで考えて行動しないとクリアはおぼつきません。
ただ、シビアなタイミング等は必要なく、こちらが1歩動くごとに敵や仕掛けが1段階動く仕様なので、詰め将棋のように時間を気にする事なくじっくり考えながら解く事ができます。
マップが狭いので、いざとなれば総当たり方式で解く事もでき、パズルが苦手でも完全に詰まる事はないはずです。
それでも解けなければヒント(と言うか解法そのもの)まで用意されていますし。

本作はスマホからの移植という事ですが、グラフィックは十分リッチでPCでも全く見劣りする事はありません。
スマホ版はSteamのセール価格よりも更にお安くなっていますが、PC版はスマホの課金アイテムが全て標準提供されているので、総額で見ればそれほど酷い差ではないようです。
追加ステージの「The Mirror of Spirits」はPC版が無料で先行リリースなので、スマホに対する優位性は十分あるのではないでしょうか。
この追加分についてもキッチリ完全日本語化されていて、既存分との違和感は全くありません。
とりあえず、セールなら即買いでいいと思います。

30367070.review:
Lara Croft GO es un buen juego de puzzle, heredero de Hitman GO en muchos aspectos de su jugabilidad pero que logra innovar y aportar su propio espacio. La clave de esto es que, aunque las mecánicas básicas de movimiento y demás son las mismas, a la hora de la verdad muchos de los elementos y retos son diferentes. Aunque muchos de los tipos de enemigos son ya vistos (los que atacan delante, los que te siguen, etc.) y muchos no aparecen en este, ahí se acaban buena parte de las similitudes en cuanto a pruebas; la razón es que la mayor parte de los retos tienen que ver con cosas tipicas de Lara Croft como interruptores, placas de presión, trampas o mover objetos, dinámicas todas diferentes de las de Hitman. 

Gráficamente el juego es resultón, aunque en este caso pierde con respecto a Hitman ya que abandona la estética de maquetas por una más similar a la de Lara habitual... lo cual acaba destacando que no tiene ni el poligonado ni las animaciones ni nada de la original en cuanto a resultado, quedando gráficamente pobre. A nivel sonoro cumple, aunque los efectos se acaban haciendo repetitivos.

El resultado es que Lara Croft GO en general cumple con todo lo que promete, quedando un buen resultado. Un 7.

30362281.review:
Hitman Go, Lara Croft Go, Deus Ex Go - не шедевры и не безусловные хиты, но однозначно одни из лучших однопользовательских мобильных игр последних лет. Их объединяет концепция - в каждой игре нужно пробраться из точки A в точку Z, избегая или уничтожая (это как придётся) противников и минуя прочие угрозы. Режим как бы пошаговый, хотя не всегда на 100% - персонаж перемещается по точкам, но противник (или какой-то триггер) может среагировать в момент хода игрока.

Почему на мой взгляд игра про Лару - лучшая из трёх? Самое главное - в ней есть дух первой Tomb Raider. Ну, той самой, где основной смысл был не в массовом рубилове и внезапных сюжетных поворотах на 180 градусов, а в исследованиях, в путешествии, в наличии тайны. Хотя для большинства наверное будет важнее, что Lara Croft Go больше других похожа на полноценную игру. Например, в Hitman Go уровни не особо связаны между собой - это просто набор головоломок по мотивам "больших" игр серии (судя по рецензиям, далеко не все фанаты от такого в восторге). А в Deus Ex Go хотя и есть своя кампания, но она больше для галочки, так как упор сделан не на ней - фишкой стали порционные наборы уровней, которые разработчики щедро поставляют еженедельно. Это прикольно, но нивелирует уникальность подхода к уровням и снижает интерес к начинающей набивать оскомину механике.

Я давно купил все 3 игры в Google Play, и с удовольствием прошёл. Может показаться, что не все мне нравятся, но это не так - все классные и у всех свои фишки (причём, не только по механике, но и по оформлению, музыке). Просто с Ларой получилось как-то лучше :) Но вот бесплатный DLC Mirror of Spirits для Lara Croft Go сделали только для PS4, PS Vita и Steam. Пришлось брать. Доволен ли я? За 50% от стоимости - да. Игра симпатичная и лучше воспринимается, когда экран существенно больше 5" - появился повод перепройти, что для меня не свойственно. DLC всего на час, но сделано высше - есть пара новых находок, которые сильно разнообразят уже знакомое ранее.

Единственное НО - управление. Нет поддержки клавиатуры! И если нет контроллера, то придётся делать пассы мышью, как будто вы проводите пальцем по экрану. У меня тачскрин, поэтому я играл с тем же управлением, как и на телефоне. Но уверен, что в других случаях было бы не очень. Впрочем, тут же пошагово, так что проиграть из-за странного управления крайне сложно, а привыкнуть - можно.

30251894.review:
OK, so this game does not define a new genre, make you re-evaluate your place in the multiverse, give you 40 years of replayability, or make you cry/laugh out loud.  Yes, it was obviously designed as a mobile game. It' just a really nicely done puzzle game. 

Now that we have that out of the way... Why do you play games? I play games for enjoyment, and I really enjoyed this game. 

The art and sound is very well done. I think overall the puzzle design, art and animation is pretty true to the world of Lara Croft even if it is a lot more stylized and simple than the jaw-dropping art in Tomb Raider. I played with a controller on my couch through my steam link and it was a great way to unwind for a little while. The controls were good overall, although there were a couple of times I got sloppy with the thumbstick and went the wrong direction. I'm pretty sure it was 96% user error. 

The puzzles are hard enough to be interesting, but not too hard  (and there are solutions out there if you get stuck). You need to realize that you're expected to die sometimes to figure out how things work. There's no penalty, so go ahead and just try that crazy idea to see what happens. The achievements aren't too onerous - I only had to retrace my steps a couple of times. The save points are well placed for the most part so you don't have to do too much tedious repetition to make it through (there was only one annoying level I can think of). I thought the optional "hidden object" part of the game where you click vases to unlock outfits and get achievements was a nice way to add a little more to the game without over-complicating it.

I just finished the Mirror of Spirits and really enjoyed that as well. The chapter added two new mechanics that made the new puzzles pretty interesting. No new achievements, but you do get a new outfit to unlock.

30159675.review:
Un escenario intrínseco, compuesto de cubos que sirven de casillas y desarrollo, y con perpectiva isométrica variable según nuestra posición pero siempre hacia el mismo politopo tridimensional, servirá de lugar de acción para el tipo de juego que Square Enix se le ha ocurrido. El tipo de juego abre y rellena el catálogo de juegos de Tomb Raider así como que consigue plasmar el significado de aquellos Tomb Raider antiguos en donde la casilla cúbica es el principal benefactor.

Trata básicamente de construir a través de la iniciativa el único camino a seguir mientras jugamos. Es un juego de memoria y trata de dar los pasos correctos, anticipándonos todo lo que podamos a las consecuencias de los siguientes turnos para actuar correctamente. Se puede catalogar como un juego de inteligencia de Tomb Raider. El juego está hecho para probar antes posibles soluciones y nunca será un inconveniente el número de reintentos, el juego está adaptado para ello.

La regla principal es que todas las sucesiones de turnos forman como una cadena, y cuando se tira de un lado el otro cede, y nunca se puede dejar de tirar, con lo que en este caso 1 + 1 serían un par de sucesiones con naturaleza intrinseca. Bajo esta regla tendremos mas facilidad y adaptabilidad para imaginar lo que va a suceder a continuación, y unido esto a la geometría del escenario y a sus elementos con buenas dinámicas, crearán soluciones lógicas y semánticas bien acopladas a lo que es la mecánica, el motor y la caja de cambios del juego, soluciones que van a ser estudio de unos cuantos intentos constructivos.

Además de la aventura incorpora un capítulo adicional donde añade un nuevo enemigo que puede regenerarse en pocos turnos después de morir, va a complicar mucho las cosas respecto a la aventura principal. ¿Saldrán dlcs con capítulos extra y así jugar en más ambientes diferentes con los trajes que vamos desbloqueando? no sé que responder.

Los Tomb Raider siempre han estado cargados de acción y arqueología así que para completar el juego se añade una realización excelente del mundo de Tomb Raider en relación a su duración y jugabilidad, y también un pequeño minijuego de encontrar vasijas ocultas por casi todos los escenarios. Su duración supongo que es acertada respecto a su precio.

30088048.review:
A proper PC version of this instant classic that adds controller support and a working fullscreen mode.

The game is an atmospheric turn-based puzzle game with a beautiful low-poly art style and a high quality melodic ambient soundtrack. (Fun fact: the menu music is an ultra slow version of the classic Tomb Raider theme.)

The main story has a steadily ramping difficulty and the expansions mix things up with new distinct environments and puzzle components like enemies that won't stay down in Shard of Light and light beam switches and your mirror image in Mirror of Spirits. The latter was made by a different team and it's interesting how you can feel it: The puzzles often look lengthier and more intimidating but are actually solved relatively easily or sometimes by accident on the first go, like I did on the very last one.

The situation is somehow reversed from the earlier episodes where the in-game hint option might start to tempt you when the solution to a seemingly simple board just eludes you. (Don't do it, you can figure it out!)

30053551.review:
Pozn.: Dohráno za 12 hodin.

Velmi zdařilá a překvapivě zábavná logická tahovka na motivy Tomb Raidera. Hra má pěkný vizuál, Lara je plně animovaná a mnohé její pohyby připomínají akční hry této slavné série. K dispozici je i celá řada outfitů pro hlavní hrdinku, takže si jí hráč může vyfiknout, jak se mu zlíbí (další outfity se odemykají kompletování reliců, které nacházíte ve hře).

Logické hádanky jsou zpočátku spíše jednoduché, ale postupem času se přitvrzuje, aby ke konci již řádně zavařily mozek. Jednotlivé rébusy ale nejsou dlouhé, takže se hráč nikdy nezasekne na tak dlouho, aby to začalo nudit. A pokud ano, k dispozici je hint systém, který vám poradí. Hratelnost je opravdu výborná.

K dispozici jsou celkově tři dobrodružství. Základní Queen of Venom je poměrně dlouhé, ale zase ne tak obtížné, zatímco bonusové The Cave of Fire je docela krátké, ale o dost složitější. 

Nově (zdarma!) přidané dobrodružství The Mirror of Spirits mě musím říct trošku zklamalo. Přináší sice nový co-op režim a nový motiv světelných detektorů, ale je velmi krátké a přitom i docela snadné. Sekl jsem se pouze jednou, a to až v úplně poslední hádance (ale ta mi dala pořádně zabrat, to zase musím uznat. :-))

Každopádně pokud rádi řešíte logické rébusy a máte rádi Tomb Raidera, GO do toho.

30049266.review:
[h1]A lesson learnt; do not judge a book by its cover...[/h1]

Dismissing [b]Lara Croft:GO[/b] several times as some sort of shallow spinoff game using the Tomb Raider popularity, a cash grab at worst or lacking content at best, Steam Store was persistent to keep recommending this. With a healthy dose of scepticism I decided to give it a try .. several hours later it had me completely hooked!

Easing you in with simple puzzles & tasks, it continues to build on its foundations. Introducing new mechanics, new enemies, larger maps, combining what you have previously learned & adding more & more layers to it. Granted, I found the puzzles for the first half of the game to be fairly straight forward, most still offered enough of a challenge to have to replay a couple times as you discover the nuances designed into each puzzle. Although these earlier levels are quick, there are a decent number of them to complete.

While working your way through each level, there are also hidden items to find. Clicking on these will collect them, but as the camera is fixed, so they may only be visible from certain squares. Finding some of these offered more challenge than the earlier puzzles! Collect a set & it will unlock other outfits for Lara. Was a good addition to the main puzzle mechanics along with the few interesting achievements to unlock which are some mini puzzles within themselves. Both offer a reasonable amount of replayablity.

The automatic camera direction gives scope/depth to the levels even when small. Graphically, the retro low-poly art design looks really good, even if some of the animations are a bit basic.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=868042618 Moving on to the later levels, especially the last location of [b]'The Caves of Fire'[/b], really upped the challenge. I probably spent more time there that all the other five combined, evening resorting to the [i]occasional[/i] hint after getting stumped for way too long [b]:)[/b] The complexity of these later puzzles was impressive, & not was I expected from a small mobile game. Leaves me really looking forward to the next Chapter, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/news/externalpost/steam_community_announcements/75836429541845116][b]'The Mirror of Spirits'[/b][/url] coming soon ... & for free!

One thing I was less impressed with was the control translation. Using an analog stick on a controller, I found the movement to be very sensitive to small movements. This often resulted in accidental miss-steps. Using Steam's built-in controller customisation I was able to reduce this sensitivity to a degree, but I do not know how many times I had to restart a puzzle due to a double step or wrong direction. 

It could have benefited from some more attention to translate the touch style interface into a more precise mapping with a controller. Works fine, if you are somewhat careful but could be better in my view. 

[b]Lara Croft:GO[/b] plays to its strengths & doesn't pretend to be anything it is not. For the price, there is a plentiful amount of content, some replayability & a decent challenge to be had. This is one of those rare mobile ports that is actually worth playing & certainly worth a recommendation!


[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6857016/]If you enjoyed reading this review, please follow [u]True Blue Reviews[/u] for more recommendations![/url]

29761018.review:
[h1]Description[/h1]

Lara Croft GO, much like Hitman GO, is a reinterpretation of the Tomb Raider game series as a puzzle game. In this turn-based stylized cell-shaded isometric 3D platform game, you'll have to think, try and retry to find the right path. Enemies move and traps activate only when you move and there is no time limit here, so you can take your time and you can retry indefinitely (or bail and use the hint system).

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] Cute art style that looks just as nice on PC as it does on tablets
[*] Mechanics so self-explanatory there is no tutorial and very little text (and no actual need for either)
[*] Hint system alleviates any potential frustration
[*] Relaxing atmosphere throughout
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] Die and retry is mandatory (though as painless as possible)
[*] Awkward mouse controls (sliding in the desired direction is clearly meant for touchscreens, I would advise using a gamepad instead)
[/list]

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

Lara Croft had already embarked on a journey through puzzle-adventure games with the Guardian of Light and Temple of Osiris. Here the logic is taken to the extreme by stripping away all the action... and yet somehow part of the feel of the franchise remains. At times, this game reminded me of the first Tomb Raider more than the rebooted Tomb Raider franchise. To me, it felt more like an answer to the question "What if the first Tomb Raider had actually been a puzzle game?" than to "What other genre can we put Lara Croft into?"

If you're a fan of Lara Croft or if you enjoy relaxing brain teasers, you'd do yourself a disservice to avoid this game.
However if all you've ever appreciated in Tomb Raider games is their action, if you despise their puzzle and platform mechanics, stay away.

29388660.review:
[h1]소개[/h1]
툼레이더의 외전 격이라 볼 수 있는 퍼즐 게임입니다. 3D 아이소메트릭 뷰 형식이며 스토리는 원
작과 동일하게 라라 크로프트를 조작해서 유물을 찾는 것입니다. 턴제 퍼즐로, 매 턴마다 적절한
이동과 스킬을 사용해야 합니다.

[h1]게임 구성[/h1]
퍼즐요소로는 몹 피하기, 버튼 누르기 형식을 취하고 있습니다. 멀리 떨어진 버튼을 눌러야 다음
장소로 가는 발판이 내려오는 식입니다. 버튼을 고정하기 위해 돌을 떨어뜨리거나 몹을 유도하는
식의 트릭이 사용되었습니다. 게임 상에 뱀과 거미 형태의 몹이 나오는데 라라는 정면에서는 이
들을 이길 수 없습니다. 우회하거나 원거리에서 일회용 스킬을, 또는 살려두어서 트릭 조작에 이
용해야 합니다. 3차원으로 구성한 맵 디자인과 다채로운 트릭 메커니즘으로 꽤나 적절한 퍼즐 난
이도를 유지하고 있다고 평가합니다. 살짝 어렵다고 느끼실 수도 있습니다.

맵 곳곳에 유물들이 숨겨져 있습니다. 클릭하면 찾아지는데, 이들을 모아서 특수복장을 언락할 수
있습니다. 특수복장이라 해도 외형변화만 있고 기능상 차이는 없습니다. 퍼즐 특성상 다회차 플레
이가 드물기에 메리트가 떨어지긴 합니다만 업적 달성으로 괜찮은 시스템과 적절한 난이도입니다.

게임 도중에 라라는 커다란 뱀에게 쫓기게 됩니다. 유물의 수호자 같은 느낌이랄까요. 중간 중간
에 라라를 습격해서 다른 곳으로 떨구는 역할입니다. 막판에는 이 뱀을 물리치고 진행해야 하는
데 연출이 훌륭합니다. 

대사가 한 마디도 없다는 점도 높이사고 싶습니다. 게임 중에 만나는 인간NPC가 없어 라라는 게
임내내 말 한마디 없이 묵묵히 앞으로 나아가는데(사실은 성우비를 아낀 거겠지만..) 이 점이 또
미지의 던전을 탐험하는 분위기에 잘 맞는 신비로운 느낌을 주네요.

[h1]아쉬운 점[/h1]
모바일 게임을 이식했기에 PC 기준으로는 인터페이스가 썩 훌륭하지 않습니다. 스테이지 선택을
위해 스마트폰에서 넘기듯이 마우스를 옆으로 끌어줘야 합니다. 이식할 때 조금만 더 신경을 썼다면 버튼을 하나 넣었을 텐데 하는 생각이 들더군요.

[h1]정리[/h1]
괜찮은 난이도와 충실한 구성을 가진 퍼즐 게임입니다. 3D 퍼즐인 툼레이더를 잘 간략화함과 동
시에 퍼즐과 액션을 잘 혼합하였습니다. 참신한 건 아니지만 완성도 높습니다. 만원 이하의 가격
으로, 큰 부담 없이 가볍게 돌려보는 게임으로 추천 드립니다.

29253109.review:
Pros:
-Great puzzle designs, starting off simple with increasing complexity and new mechanics added as the story progresses. It’s not too challenging but if you get stuck there is a walkthrough mode.  
-The aesthetic is pleasing and the cartoon fashion will keep it timeless. 
-Story is told without any words but is clearly told and once you face the final boss it gives you great satisfaction. 
-Nostalgia, the game is in all respect a Tomb Raider game, the feel and look of it match that of early games being a true tribute to it’s predecessor focusing on puzzles over mindless action.  


Cons: 
-The game is a port from phone. It has touch screen controls, meaning you have to click and drag as if you were playing as on a touch screen to move Lara. 
-In addition there are no hotkeys to get to restart you have to go to menu then click restart button. Not a big deal but takes you out of the game. 
-Buggy text boxes. The game has few moments where it introduces a new mechanics and it is explained with a text box however during my play through the text boxes stayed on screen for a millisecond before disappearing. 

General Thoughts:
	This game is a wonderful representation of what Lara Croft used to be, if you ever played the original games the main menu screen will tug on your nostalgia strings immediately. The puzzles are of good in complexity if rather simple at times, however the final chapter really testing your skills. The collectables allow you to unlock costumes that Lara has worn over her lifetime making them somewhat worth your time if you’re a fan. The worst part of the game is the port quality and how unintuitive the controls are at the start of the game, I thought my game was broken and with no control menu you’d have to look it up online how to actually play the game. I figured out the click and drag controls by sheer coincidence. The game could have been perfect puzzle game if they put effort into the port and made the controls more intuitive and given a hotkey for restarting levels.

29102876.review:
It's weird that the Tomb Raider games are about Lara Croft and the Lara Croft games are about Tomb Raiding. This is a really simple turn-based tile puzzle game with a few basic mechanics that are mixed into very interesting combinations. You learn everything through experimentation while playing and the pacing of this is masterfully done.

Occasionally story moments happen, but they're seamlessly woven into the gameplay. They're purely action spectacle with no dialog. Visually the game looks great. It has a low poly classic look. You can choose from a few optional Lara Croft outfits from her previous adventures. The audio very subdued, but works well in the background.

Input is a little weird. The swipes are clearly designed for mobile, but once you get into the flow of the game it feels fine. I wish there was an alternative, but I also understand the limitation with the game being built on a diagonal.

Overall this is a great pure puzzle game with excellent production values. I hope they make more games like it.

28299919.review:
Lara Croft GO is a concise and enjoyable turn-based puzzle game that carefully integrates some basic traits from the Tomb Raider franchise. The environmental hazards, position-based puzzles, and deadly spiders are just some of those thematic changes. Square Enix Montreal's turned-based recipe, which was a fraction more effective in Hitman GO, is flexible enough to provide clever puzzles even when new tools change the rules. With about three hours of satisfying challenges—and two more in the harder bonus tomb—this is a puzzler that can be played in short or long sessions. Lara Croft GO demonstrates that, when it comes to porting franchises to different genres, Square Enix Montreal are taking the right steps.

28266764.review:
1: Obviously this is a port of a mobile game, and apparantly it is much cheaper in that format. So I guess if that's an option for you, go that rout instead of picking it up on steam. 

2: The puzzles were a lot of fun, although far too simple early on. I realize that's just common game design, teaching you the rules before letting you dive in fully. But in truth, it takes a large chunk of the entire main campaign before they really let loose with any tricky stuff.

2.5: The fifth "new adventure" chapter is definitely where the best puzzling is, and where about 3.5 of my 8 hours(for full 100% achievements) was spent... though a huge chunk of that was spent hugely overthinking two specific puzzles.  I've seen another reviewer mention their length to be around 5 hours, and that sounds about right for anyone who "gets it" right off the bat(and does everything there is to do without looking anything up... If you skip all the collecting, and achievements, I'm sure you could plow through in a couple hours).

3: I'm sure the aesthetic is going to be hit or miss for a lot of people, but I personally found it to be gorgeous. The music was also perfectly atmospheric. While every aspect of the gameplay is pure puzzling, the game is designed(and more importantly presented) in such a way that it definitely still gives  a strong feeling of thrills and action. Especially towards the end of the main campaign.

Honestly, this game felt like the perfect minimalist companion to the old school Tomb Raider games... and without any of those damn swimming levels to boot. Again, I recognize that it can be found cheaper elseware, but I in know way felt cheated by the 8$ I spent on it. And if you wait for an epic steam sale, it's absolutely 100% worth whatever pittance you'll end up paying for it.

28259664.review:
I bought this game two times already, once on the Windows Store, once on Steam.
I completed it 100% on Steam for the first time and I must say it's a very very good game.
It's cheaper on Mobile and the Windows Store as of now, but the Steam version is the definitive edition imho, with Achievements, Cards and GAMEPAD SUPPORT!
Plus you get the first expansion free, and there's another one coming in three months or so.

It is a turn-based puzzle game starring Lara Croft. I am a fan of the series since the first game came out on PC and I must say, I haven't had this much fun with a Tomb Raider game since the classics.
It gets so many things right, the puzzles are hard and satisfying, the soundtrack is top notch, the presentation is great overall. 
If you're into puzzle games, this game is for you.
If you're into classic Tomb Raider games, this game is for you.
If you're looking for an Action/Adventure Uncharted-like game, this one is not for you, but you might like it anyway, since it's very well crafted.

Pro:
- Level Design is well thought, and the puzzles are satisfying.
- The art style is great
- The soundtrack is great
- Good level of difficulty
- 6-7 Hours of lenght

Cons:
- Low Poly which might be a turnoff for someone, but it holds up very well in motion, I personally love it
- Might become frustrating if you're not able to solve a puzzle (there's an help button for that though)
- The price is higher than the Mobile or Windows Store version but it has more functionalities (Gamepad Support, Antialiasing enabled, Steam Cards and Achievements)

28256998.review:
There has been a lot of flake going around about the price of Lara Croft GO, and how it was cheaper on phone, or even just the windows store. Despite that being a relatively shitty move by square enix; I still bought it. I completed the entire game + the "extra" mission. And I recommend it.

The minimalistic graphics are wonderful, it's sleek and soothing. And the puzzles are hard enough that once I solve them, I cannot believe I hadn't figured it out before.

I love puzzles, but I'm bad at them. So I must admit to actually using the hint-feature. And even if YOU think you're bad at this sort of game, you can still complete it, enjoy the puzzles you can beat and when you get stuck the "hint" button will show you what you were supposed to do. Step by step. 

It's a short game compared to the price, there are other games in the same price-class that will give you endless hours of entertainment. But if you have the money, this puzzle game is a must to experience!

On regrette peut-être sa simplicité relative ? (le dernier monde étant quant à lui d'une complexité à faire pâlir le reste du jeu, dommage qu'il ne s'agisse que d'un monde et qu'il apparaisse tardivement)

Les succès s'obtiennent tous assez simplement.

Mais parce que tout n'est pas négatif (Sinon je recommanderai pas le jeu, roh, voyons)

La difficulté pour tous les obtenir est quand même au rendez-vous: Les vases où se trouvent reliques et pierres précieuses se cachent très bien, et parfois il faut activer un élément pour l'entrevoir !

En soit les graphismes sont simples, épurés, et disons le: jolis

Et petit bonus, on retrouve parfoiss la magnifique et célèbre pirouette de la Lady quand elle monte un rebord (je pense qu'elle ne se fait pas par hasard, mais j'ai la flemme d'essayer,..)

28207017.review:
One of the best puzzle games I have ever played in my life. The puzzles are interactive, varied, elegant and interesting! Preparing traps for your enemies, monsters inadvertently helping you or foiling your plans, weird chain reactions...

There are also new levels that introduce totally new gameplay, never seen before in other versions of the game. I'd say the authors chose very interesting ideas to explore in the new level pack.

The overall style of the game demonstrates the beauty of minimalism, both in graphical aesthetics and in game design. And, sadly (or happily?), Lara Croft GO manages to be way more Tomb Raider in its core than the current "Miss Uncharted" main game. You will find a lot of genuine homage to the original Tomb Raider games anywhere you look, from the ambient sound to the main menu, but most importantly, the gameplay is pure gold.

NOTE: Gamepad recommended for best experience.
